sub_topic: Finding the vertex cover of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

```
    A----B 
   / \   | 
  /   \  | 
 C-----D-E
```
Find the minimum vertex cover of this graph.
message_2:
A minimum vertex cover is a set of vertices such that each edge in the graph is incident to at least one vertex in the set, and the set has the smallest possible number of vertices.

In this graph, one possible minimum vertex cover is {A, D, E}. This set has 3 vertices, and each edge in the graph is connected to at least one of these vertices:

- Edge AB is connected to vertex A
- Edge AC is connected to vertex A
- Edge AD is connected to vertex A
- Edge BC is connected to vertex D
- Edge BD is connected to vertex D
- Edge DE is connected to vertex D
- Edge BE is connected to vertex E

Therefore, the minimum vertex cover of this graph is {A, D, E}.
